title: Helen Bailey: Author 'drugged and suffocated'
text:
Image copyright Hertfordshire Police Image caption Author Helen Bailey was last seen alive on 11 April 2016 Children's author Helen Bailey was secretly drugged by her partner for a number of months before he suffocated her and buried her body in a cesspit, a court has heard. 
The 51-year-old's body was found in the grounds of her home in Royston, Hertfordshire, in July. She had been missing since 11 April. 
Her partner Ian Stewart, 56, denies murder. 
They were engaged and were planning a wedding to take place "imminently". 
St Albans Crown Court heard the couple had met online following the death of Ms Bailey's husband, John Sinfield in 2011, and moved in together a year after they met, buying the house in Royston for around Â£1.5m. 
Prosecutors told the jury they had made arrangements for Mr Stewart to obtain the house and "substantial financial advantage" in the event of Ms Bailey's death before the wedding. Image copyright South Beds News Agency Image caption Helen Bailey and Ian Stewart were to be married, the court has heard 
Stuart Trimmer QC, prosecuting, said Mr Stewart had been giving Ms Bailey sleeping pills since December 2015 before killing her on 11 April 2016. 
He "killed her, probably by suffocation whilst she was sedated by the drugs he administered", Mr Trimmer said. 
A drug used to treat insomnia, Zoplicone, was found in her system, which had been prescribed to Mr Stewart, the court was told. 
The trial continues.
